title: How to Add an "E Mail Me!" Link to Your Web Page

steps.headline: Decide to which page you want to add your link.
Open the page's HTML file in your favorite editor.
steps.description: Notepad works just fine for Windows users.

steps.headline: Locate where in the file you wish to insert the link.
steps.description: For instance, if you want the link to appear at the bottom of your web page you should insert the code at the end of the HTML file.

steps.headline: Type (or copy and paste) the following in the place selected in the previous step:          <a href="mailto: [youremailaddress@yourprovider.com]?subject= &body= "> Email me!
If you wish, enter a subject for the emails after the           subject= portion.
Also optional: Insert text that will appear in the body (main part) of the email after the          body=  portion.
steps.description: Otherwise, remove         &body= (unless you have already removed the "&", in which case you will just remove "body=")

steps.headline: If you are not using either the subject or body sections, remove           ?
Replace the words       Email me!
steps.description: with whatever text of which you wish the link to consist.

steps.headline: Preview your web page in the browser of your choice.
If you're satisfied with your changes, upload the new page to your host.
steps.description: Otherwise, start back at step 1 to change your page.

text: Decide to which page you want to add your link. Open the page's HTML file in your favorite editor. Notepad works just fine for Windows users. Locate where in the file you wish to insert the link. For instance, if you want the link to appear at the bottom of your web page you should insert the code at the end of the HTML file. Type (or copy and paste) the following in the place selected in the previous step: Email me! Replace [youremailaddress@yourprovider.com]with your email address. If you wish, enter a subject for the emails after the subject= portion. If not, delete subject= & Also optional: Insert text that will appear in the body (main part) of the email after the body= portion. Otherwise, remove &body= (unless you have already removed the "&", in which case you will just remove "body=") If you are not using either the subject or body sections, remove ? after the email address. Replace the words Email me! with whatever text of which you wish the link to consist. Save the changes. Preview your web page in the browser of your choice. If you're satisfied with your changes, upload the new page to your host. Otherwise, start back at step 1 to change your page.
